summary:
Israel’s intensifying bombardment of Gaza City, undertaken ahead of a planned offensive, frames today’s global headlines, with Gaza health authorities reporting hundreds of deaths as strikes concentrate on densely populated neighborhoods. Against this backdrop, aid agencies and a UN body report that restrictions on food and other supplies have contributed to a deepening humanitarian crisis and the formal confirmation of famine conditions, while Gaza Civil Defence figures cite the destruction of more than 1,000 buildings — evidence of both immediate civilian harm and sharply reduced capacity for shelter and basic services. In parallel, calls from international actors for unhindered humanitarian corridors have grown louder, even as military planning on the ground suggests the prospect of further devastation that will complicate relief operations and displacement patterns.

The fallout is already reverberating through diplomacy and domestic politics: a Dutch foreign minister’s resignation over a failed push for sanctions on Israel underscores widening European divisions, while other states confront their own security dilemmas — from Nigeria’s intensified air strikes against jihadist groups, which risk further civilian harm, to a U.S. political leader’s threat to deploy troops to Baltimore that signals the domestic politicization of force. Natural disaster risk in Southeast Asia is rising too, as mass evacuations ordered for Typhoon Kajiki in Vietnam will demand humanitarian bandwidth increasingly tied up by conflict zones. Financial strains appear in another register with Evergrande’s delisting from Hong Kong, a reminder that economic fragility can amplify social stresses, even as smaller human-interest developments — a rescued baby gorilla slated for rehabilitation and a major tennis figure advancing at the US Open — briefly punctuate the news cycle. Taken together, these threads point to a near-term environment of heightened geopolitical risk and market uncertainty that will test multilateral coordination on both humanitarian relief and economic stability.

headlines.title: Trump threatens deployment of troops to Baltimore to curb crime
headlines.summary: Trump threatens to deploy troops to Baltimore to curb crime, drawing criticism from Democrats and a governor who calls it an abuse of power.

headlines.title: Evergrande delists from Hong Kong after steep decline
headlines.summary: The embattled developer exits the Hong Kong market amid a years-long debt crisis, raising questions about liquidity and wider property-sector risks.

headlines.title: Typhoon Kajiki prompts mass evacuation orders as it approaches Vietnam
headlines.summary: Authorities urge mass evacuations as Typhoon Kajiki tracks toward Vietnam after brushing Hainan, threatening floods, power outages, and agricultural losses.

headlines.title: Israel steps up bombardment of Gaza City ahead of planned offensive
headlines.summary: Israel steps up bombardment of Gaza City ahead of planned offensive, with hundreds reported killed in recent strikes, according to Gaza health authorities.

headlines.title: Nigerian military reports over 30 jihadists killed in air strikes
headlines.summary: Military says air strikes kill jihadists, signaling intensified fighting and rising civilian harm amid concerns about escalating violence in region.

headlines.title: Israel restricts food into Gaza as famine worsens
headlines.summary: Aid agencies say Israeli restrictions hinder aid supplies while a UN body confirms famine in Gaza, prompting calls for humanitarian access and relief.

headlines.title: Rescued baby gorilla recovers from smuggling ordeal
headlines.summary: Turkish authorities name the infant gorilla Zeytin and aim to rehabilitate him before possible return to Nigeria after rescue from smugglers.

headlines.title: Djokovic advances in first-round match at US Open
headlines.summary: The top-ranked player shows uneven form but advances after a tough test against Learner Tien in New York on outdoor court.

headlines.title: Dutch foreign minister resigns over sanctions push on Israel over Gaza
headlines.summary: The resignation follows failure to secure sanctions against Israel, highlighting growing European division over Gaza policy and international responses to press for change.

headlines.title: Israel destroys over 1,000 buildings in Gaza City, Civil Defence says
headlines.summary: Civil Defence reports extensive destruction in Gaza City as casualties rise and international calls to halt the conflict go unheeded.
